title_review: By far the best "authentic" pizza in Madrid!
review_preview: Expat living in Madrid for 4 years now.I've been coming here since the first month living in Madrid.This is a small place, that has some "outpost" around Madrid.This is an authentic pizza place, the staff is extremely nice, and are all actually...
review_full: Expat living in Madrid for 4 years now. I've been coming here since the first month living in Madrid. This is a small place, that has some "outpost" around Madrid. This is an authentic pizza place, the staff is extremely nice, and are all actually either Italian or Sicilian. The prices are very reasonable. You can't go wrong with ordering a pizza or any of the fresh pastas. They have a nice selection of Italian wines, a nice change from the Spanish wines. The melted mozzarella appetizer is on point.  If you have a craving for good authentic Italian food, this is the place!! Just be sure to make a reservation, as it's small and fills up quickly and most people do make reservations in advance. The second best pizza I've had outside of Italy.

After all, it has the best and most delightfully surprising Japanese food in the city. The charming ambience with the amazing decorations really gives the place a great touch to the wonderful overall experience. The service provided is also great; very helpful, attentive and knowledful. I always ask the servers what the recommendations are and, let me tell you, they never go wrong. I get to try new foods that leave me speechless, such as the Tuna Timbal dish, a must for me since I had it not long ago, of which I am posting a picture. When I travel to Madrid, about once or twice a year, I always come to DokiDoki, my favourite restaurant, where I feel like family. Go and see what I'm talking about for yourself, I can only describe so much but the overall amazing experience is something only you can live. Keep up the GREAT job DokiDoki! Which truly makes my heart beat (DokiDoki means heartbeat).

review_preview: It's a small, cute cafe for vegetarians with organic wines and beers available, nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. If u want to have lunch , come before 4, cause after that only snacks re available, small tapas, soups and desserts. Dinner starts at 8.30pm...

review_preview: VEGA was the best restaurant of our trip! Incredible and creative Vegan food. They had a menu in English which is great if you only speak a little bit of Spanish! Food was cheap 4.50 Euro for a trio of appetizers, and we got three...
review_full: VEGA was the best restaurant of our trip! Incredible and creative Vegan food. They had a menu in English which is great if you only speak a little bit of Spanish! Food was cheap 4.50 Euro for a trio of appetizers, and we got three Tapas for 5.50 Euro each. We ordered for appetizers: Smoked eggplant pate, Oriental Sauerkraut, and Roasted red peppers with pears and walnuts. For tapas we ordered: 1. Rosemary focaccia with roasted vegetables, smoked "cheese" and tapenade. 2. Tomato carpaccio with truffle oil, arugula, and cashew pesto. 3. Ceviche with mushroom, veggie noodles, and sweet potato. Everything was as good as it sounds! This was the lunch menu. They close for a few hours in the middl elf the day and reopen for supper.

review_preview: Me and my sister stayed in Madrid for four days last month and we visited this place twice because of how lovely everything was, the staff, the food and how cheap it is for such a good quality tasty vegan meal . being in another...
review_full: Me and my sister stayed in Madrid for four days last month and we visited this place twice because of how lovely everything was, the staff, the food and how cheap it is for such a good quality tasty vegan meal . being in another country and feeling so welcomed and looked after by the owners as soon as we stepped through the door was the highlight, one of the owners who is also the chef took his time to come over and explain what everything on the menu was and while we were eating he even brought over a plate of pasta for us on the house, his wife who is also the other owner is so lovely even though it was busy she came over a few times to make sure everything was ok and to see if we needed anything else.  i can not stress it enough but the owners are seriously the nicest people, they wouldn't even accept a tip when i offered. we both left feeling so happy to know that there is still such genuinely kind people out there. if i return to Madrid which i probably will i will not leave without visiting this place. i wish the owners all the success and happiness they really deserve it! if you're in Madrid make sure you visit even if you're not a vegan you wont be disappointed! p.s the quinoa burger is amazing and i miss the lemon and coconut cake so much!

review_preview: I was so happy to find a vegan restaurant near my accommodation in Madrid.  It's not a big place and seems to be very popular.  It maybe a good idea to book as they do tend to fill up fast.  The first time I went...
review_full: I was so happy to find a vegan restaurant near my accommodation in Madrid. It's not a big place and seems to be very popular. It maybe a good idea to book as they do tend to fill up fast. The first time I went I had a burger and chips which was ok but not the best I've had. On my second visit, I had quinoa balls, tofu mix and salad followed by a lemon tart. Both were really tasty and I left happy and full. The burgers are 8,50 Euros as is the salad plate with quinoa and tofu. the waitress really made an effort to inform me about what was on the menu even though her English was not great ( I knew I should have kept learning Spanish ). It's a lovely place and will return next time I'm in that area of Madrid.

title_review: Reservation required, meals only served after 8pm
review_preview: WE arrived at about 7pm looking for something to eat but just like the rest of Madrid this restaurant only serves dinner after 8pm, Madrilanos eat late and very few restaurants cater for early eating tourists from Asia, USA or Northern Europe. If you can...
review_full: WE arrived at about 7pm looking for something to eat but just like the rest of Madrid this restaurant only serves dinner after 8pm, Madrilanos eat late and very few restaurants cater for early eating tourists from Asia, USA or Northern Europe. If you can wait until after 8pm you will still need a reservation here, it really is that popular and is not that big a place. To be fair the waitress and owner sat us down and served us a lovely soup and tapas, so we left refreshed and full just after 8pm. At least 4 other couples arrived soon after us and we all accommodated in the same way, presumably vacating their tables before 8.30 when the locals arrived! Excellent food, lovely wine and friendly service, recommend it to any vegan/vegetarian but make a reservation

review_preview: We visited on a Saturday night and they were full (so definitely book in advance, thankfully we had). The atmosphere was great, it's a small place and it was bustling. The dining style is fairly casual with high tables, people eating at the bar and...
review_full: We visited on a Saturday night and they were full (so definitely book in advance, thankfully we had). The atmosphere was great, it's a small place and it was bustling. The dining style is fairly casual with high tables, people eating at the bar and regular tables but the food was very special. We ordered tapas and tried some local beers and had a really fun evening. We were visiting for our anniversary celebrations and the food served was definitely suitable for such an occasion. We shared croquettas, a really interesting green tomato salad, bruschettas and a few other bits. I'd definitely recommend a visit if you're over on that side of town. The staff spoke good English and were patient when my terrible Spanish was difficult to understand which I'm grateful for. My only criticism would be that the waitress who greeted us was quite rude about our booking, trying to turn us away. This was a bit of a poor start given we'd booked quite far in advance and said it was for an anniversary meal. I'm sure it was just because it was busy and they're only human after all. The experience was nothing but positive from the moment we sat down.

title_review: Very tasty local food in Madrid
review_preview: An excellent small tapas restaurant on a small cobblestoned street off Paseo del Prado.  We arrived around 7:45pm and there were already some people there, however the restaurant very quickly filled up from 8pm with locals calling in for a quick drink after work or...
review_full: An excellent small tapas restaurant on a small cobblestoned street off Paseo del Prado. We arrived around 7:45pm and there were already some people there, however the restaurant very quickly filled up from 8pm with locals calling in for a quick drink after work or for dinner. The empanadas are excellent - we had the meat empanada and the Caprese empanada and had to order another serving, they were that good! Also enjoyed a serving of Provolone cheese - served hot with tomato, spices and herbed bread. A good range of red wines is available with a smaller range of white wines. We enjoyed a nice dry white wine from a north-western region of Spain. Good background music and very helpful and friendly staff - we very much recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a more local 'off the tourist trail' vibe.

title_review: Hidden gem, delicious food and great service...try the empanadas!!

review_full: Stumbled upon this hidden gem after an evening of walking around the Reina Sofia Museo. Three of us were looking for something tasty and reasonable. The cafes/tapas bars in the square of the museum were ridiculously overpriced and looked less than appetizing. Checked out trip advisor and saw this highly rated place. We were NOT disappointed. We went to the address and saw the place was packed. The waiter explained to us there was another location right around the corner...and walked us there too! Walked into Tinto y Tapas II and we‚Äôre taken right to a table. The (new) waiter was kind, curteous, and very patient, he also spoke English beautifully! We tried a variety of menu items including the jam√≥n and manchego cheese, the margarita pizza and lastly the empanadas. We could‚Äôve just ordered the empanadas, so delicious!! Throughout the meal, our waiter was very attentive, but not overwhelming in any way. Highly recommended!!!

review_full: I've been meaning to post a review about his little gem right in the heart of Chueca after always coming back for more. So today, I decided it's time to share some of its goodness with you. First of all prices are very well tuned with the portions, contrary to other European restaurants where food is presented on your plate as if you are visiting a museum, just a bit of this and that. The appetizers are delicious, my favorite is the caponata, it comes in a freshly baked bread bowl. Then I need some salad, I tried them all, so good. And finally homemade pasta and pizza worth coming back for. Of course one can always save a little space for dessert, don't leave without trying the tiramisu or panacota.....enjoy!

review_preview: Outstanding; a real production of love and talent for Italian food. The food and service were consistently good and a "standout" compared to other places we tried in Madrid. Elisa and crew took care of us.  The margherita and diavola pizza, gnocci and arugula salad...
review_full: Outstanding; a real production of love and talent for Italian food. The food and service were consistently good and a "standout" compared to other places we tried in Madrid. Elisa and crew took care of us. The margherita and diavola pizza, gnocci and arugula salad were all exquisite. The pesto lasagne was divine. We eat a lot of Italian so we know it when we see it and of course, eat it. Make sure you finish with the tiramisu and the limoncello. Don't miss this place. It's small so you might want to make a reservation. Hate to say good bye. Thanks for making our first visit to Madrid extra special!

review_preview: If you're in Madrid, and you need a break from Jam√≥n Ib√©rico, definitely try this delicious pizza place! It's a short walk from Puerta del Sol, down a bustling main street, and then a few blocks down a smaller (yet, still busy) street. The pizza...
review_full: If you're in Madrid, and you need a break from Jam√≥n Ib√©rico, definitely try this delicious pizza place! It's a short walk from Puerta del Sol, down a bustling main street, and then a few blocks down a smaller (yet, still busy) street. The pizza is thin crust and the perfect size for 2 people to split. I was surprised at how delicious and flavorful it was! I'm from NYC, where there's a pizza place on every corner, and this place can go head to head with some of the best I've had. The restaurant is very quaint and cute, but small, so probably not great for large groups. My husband and I walked right in at around 9 pm on a Sunday night and were seated immediately. The waiters were extremely nice and accommodating, as I made a request to have half of the pizza plain and the other half "diavola." The diavola was so good and not too spicy--just right! The plain was perfect and the pizza sauce was sweet and delicious. We also started with the bruschetta, which I recommend as well. They gave us 6 pieces on very soft, fresh baguette--3 were topped with the traditional tomato mixture, 2 had fresh mozzarella, and 1 had a very good eggplant mixture! All were drizzled with incredibly tasty olive oil. All and all, I would highly recommend this restaurant!

review_full: This location was recommended by the staff at Villa Magna hotel. After visiting St James restaurant many times we wanted to try something else, and this place didnt dissapoint. It's a bit of a challenge to locate (as you just dont think that its in the street it is) and knocking on the door and waiting to be let into the restaurant is a little strange (but fun). The specialise in Patella (different pan for cooking paella) and it was delicious. Prior to the main dish, there was plenty of tapas etc. to try. The highlight was the 'bucket' of butter that you get with the 10 different varieties of pan (bread).  One downside is that you are squashed into a room with probably too many tables/chairs for the size of the place.  The staff are friendly, they accomodate to all your requests and go out of their way to make you feel special. Definately worth a try

The waiters are impecably trained and gracious (mostly from the Philippines) The paella has a good reputation but you will be disappointed if you expect a traditional one. Though tasty, the ones here are very thin and not enough food for three. The cost is around 30 euros per portion. A lot to pay for very little food. We ordered one for three people and paid almost 100 euros for it. However by the time the paella arrived we had been served several bite size tapas on the house. We added one salad and one desert and wine and our bill was 260 euros. Worth going to but expect to spend quite a bit and remember to make a reservation as it is very popular

review_preview: Good things first: The food. The Pizza was good as well as the antipasti, the pasta was okay, the red wine too.The rest was a huge disappointment. The service was unfriendly. We always had the feeling like they pushed us to buy more. Okay,...
review_full: Good things first: The food. The Pizza was good as well as the antipasti, the pasta was okay, the red wine too. The rest was a huge disappointment. The service was unfriendly. We always had the feeling like they pushed us to buy more. Okay, selling food is there work, but they didn't give us time to choose properly from the menu (we took 5 minutes extra to translate the menu for some friends) and when the noticed that we would take some moments more, they started to treat us badly. The food got served quickly but they were not waiting till everyone had finished at the table to clear the table. We felt rushed all the time. With our glasses still half full, the waitress filled up our glasses to the top and then asked us if we wanted another one. That was just rude. In the end we didn't take any desert or coffee. We got handed our bill without having asked for it.  Also, we could see how someone, who looked like he had made a reservation, got turned away because the restaurante was full. Even with having a starter we lasted hardly 45 minutes in the restaurante. While we were expecting a nice dinner in an Italian restaurante, we got rushed to eat and to pay. Everything seems to be made to maximize the profit, which is okay, but you shouldn't make it feel the customer. If you want a good pizza in 20 minutes time, it's okay. If you want a nice evening, enjoying good food, you might wanna think of going somewhere else. Finally, prices on the menu are shown without VAT, which is, while legal, unusual for restaurantes of this category in Spain.

title_review: Questo √® un assaggio della dolce vita! [A taste of the sweet (Italian) life!]
review_preview: High standards of freshness are expected in all of the countries of the Mediterranean region. As I have noted in my reviews of restaurants that purport to be Italian, I hold them to the high standards of authentic Italian cooking (i.e., freshness and quality of...
review_full: High standards of freshness are expected in all of the countries of the Mediterranean region. As I have noted in my reviews of restaurants that purport to be Italian, I hold them to the high standards of authentic Italian cooking (i.e., freshness and quality of ingredients, flavor, use of seasonings instead of over-use of salt, origin of cheeses, oils, etc.) and ambiance. The menu of this restaurant, like most Italian restaurants primarily serving pizza, is not extensive. It doesn‚Äôt need to be. The quality of the pizza is delicious. This cozy restaurant compares very favorably in all respects to the taste of pizza and modest and pasta dishes you would find in small towns in Italy. It reminds me of a place I used to frequent a few blocks from Termini Station in Rome in the 1990‚Äôs. Our meal was topped off with a complimentary shot of Limoncello. What a nice touch!  If you are staying in Chueca (the region of Madrid where Pizzaiolo is located) for a lengthy visit, there is an excellent and reasonably-price laundry a few doors away on the same side of Calle Hortaleza. If you plan accordingly, you can have your laundry done while at dinner- or do you can do in yourself. For Americans, the charge is for the load, not per piece as is customary in the USA. We found this helpful in spending our time more productively rather than sitting waiting for the laundry to be done.

review_preview: I've been coming here for years now and this place never disappoints. Because of it's central location it's popular both with tourists and locals. Everything on the menu is delicious, prices are very fair (I think most dishes are under 10 euro), the house wine...
review_full: I've been coming here for years now and this place never disappoints. Because of it's central location it's popular both with tourists and locals. Everything on the menu is delicious, prices are very fair (I think most dishes are under 10 euro), the house wine is good and the service is quick and friendly. The restaurant itself is quite small but very nicely decorated, with an informal atmosphere. Great both for a couples night or an evening with friends. The place gets packed late at night (Spanish dinner time) and on weekends so it's a good idea to make a reservation before you go.

The beer selection was less than stellar, but they did have a decent selection of wine, and I go back to the food. The ingredients come from the Italian market around the corner, and mmmmmm it's good.

review_preview: My husband and I arrived in Madrid today from Seville.  We wanted to get some Italian food not to far from the hotel so we picked this restaurant based on other reviewer's comments.  We found the place easily and enjoyed the restaurant atmosphere.   My husband...
review_full: My husband and I arrived in Madrid today from Seville. We wanted to get some Italian food not to far from the hotel so we picked this restaurant based on other reviewer's comments. We found the place easily and enjoyed the restaurant atmosphere. My husband ordered the prosciutto and fungi pizza and I ordered raviolis. I tried my husbands pizza and thought the dough was excellent however, the prosciutto is not prosciutto crudo as we anticipated. It's actually prosciutto cotto (cooked ham) which was a little disappointing from our perspective. If the effect is Neapolitan pizza, it was close but not truly that crisp southern Italian style pizza you experience in Naples. My ravioli portion was a bit small for the price but still good. We ordered the tiramisu and two coffees. Our small annoyance came when we went to pay the bill. Our bill was 35.53‚Ç¨ and we gave them 50‚Ç¨, so we expected to receive 14.47‚Ç¨ in return. We were shorted 10‚Ç¨. While the matter did get addressed, the resolution behavior warranted us to make readers/reviewers aware to check change and not be afraid to speak up (even as foreigners).  The food was good as well as the restaurant decor. unfortunately, the check experience left us not wanting to return.

title_review: One of the best restaurants in Spain
review_preview: We picked Casa Benigna out of the Fodor's guide for our last dinner in Spain.  It's in a neighborhood to the north, far from where we were staying on the Paseo del Prado.  Getting there by subway was a bit of an adventure, as the...
review_full: We picked Casa Benigna out of the Fodor's guide for our last dinner in Spain. It's in a neighborhood to the north, far from where we were staying on the Paseo del Prado. Getting there by subway was a bit of an adventure, as the streets in the area are not well marked. Next time I'll spring for the taxi for simplicity.  Having found the restaurant, we were seated in the dining room, we were seated. The server was quick and attentive. The bread came with two olive oils and a balsamic vinaigrette. This was the first time I've been served olive oils where I could really taste the difference in them. Fantastic educational experience! We ordered several appetizers, and each was better than the last, finishing with a wonderful alcahofas con jamon y huevo. Now I understand the Spanish fixation on jamon Iberico. For the main course, we had the patella (paella) de arroz de pescado--seafood paella. This was my first opprtunity to try paella after hearing about it for years, and I found it excellent. It's the house specialty here, with the chef having designed custom pans to get the cooking characteristics he wants for the dish. The atmosphere was very nice, kind of low-key. The dining room is small, maybe 10 tables, so it never gets too loud. The dishes are all made for the restaurant. The service was perfect, attentive without being pushy. Overall, one of our best dining experiences in our 12 days in Spain.

title_review: Tourist trap with average paellas that are ridiculously overpriced
review_preview: So my companion and I had vegetarian paella for two and it came to ‚Ç¨54. This is just so crazy. It was a plate of rice with some cauliflower and green beans! This is more than what you would pay for two fillet steaks at...
review_full: So my companion and I had vegetarian paella for two and it came to ‚Ç¨54. This is just so crazy. It was a plate of rice with some cauliflower and green beans! This is more than what you would pay for two fillet steaks at a posh place. A few other small items, two glasses of wine, and the bill came to over ‚Ç¨90. The food was totally average if not poor. They charge a ‚Ç¨6 cover and, for that, you get odd little bites like cold fried potato chips and crudites. There was a definite shellfish flavour off thr paella so that either came from the stock or the paella dish and we asked that it be totally vegetarian. The only wine they were prepared to serve by the glass was one type of rioja. The staff, who are all Fillipino, kept speaking English to my native Spanish-speaking companion. Indeed there was no Spanish to be heard as everyone in the dining room was a tourist/business traveller . It was all very surreal. Also the menu is, in my view, deliberately deceiving. Starters are priced per plate but the paella is priced per person - this is not made clear at all. If you want a jolly place (the waiters are friendly) to have an average, insanely expensive paella, I suppose this place will do, but do not expect an authentic or good dining experience. I'm frankly baffled by the glowing reviews to be found here which were the reason I had come to this place.

review_preview: We've lived in Madrid for a few months and this is by far our favorite place! We love craft beer and Madrid has a decent selection of craft beer spots, but this place suits us the best.  The owners are very friendly, they speak excellent...
review_full: We've lived in Madrid for a few months and this is by far our favorite place! We love craft beer and Madrid has a decent selection of craft beer spots, but this place suits us the best. The owners are very friendly, they speak excellent English, and are willing to help in any way. The atmosphere is relaxing and just a great place to enjoy great beer and meet beer fans from around the world, many of them English speaking. There are 7 beers on tap, always rotating, but they make sure there is something for all styles available. If you don't like what's on tap, there is an excellent cold bottle/can selection. I am more of an IPA fan and there has been a consistently new selection of bottles to choose from. This is also a great place to buy beer to go and they sell gift packs, like an Advent Calendar of Beer for the holidays (which we loved).  If you love craft beer and friendly people, you need to stop by!

review_full: went there after i found great reviews about this place, and was not disappointed! Staff are very welcoming and friendly, manager took us to their kitchen so we could see our food being prepared, then the chef brought the finished dish and came to our table for that extra personal touch! the Palella was so tasty and fresh, just perfect! we also had their Jamon, very beautiful , and they offered us smoked Salmon on the house, very delicious...lastly some nice strawberry sorbet to end the late lunch in style! highly recommended place if you want the best Palella in the coolest atmosphere...
